m_DescList: Appending <color=#FF68DD>?</color> after a regular expression indicates that the preceding expression may occur 0 or 1 time.
For instance, <color=#3173FF>\d</color><color=#FF68DD>+</color><color=#AB2800>%</color><color=#FF68DD>?</color> means: there may be a "%" following a series of consecutive digits.
Now you are given an "ASCII" art, and you need to count all the digit '8's. If there is a '.' immediately before an '8', include that '.' as well.
For example, for <color=#3c3cff>11.88</color> the expected matching result is <color=#666666>11</color><color=#3c3cff>.88</color>
Please construct a regular expression to pass all the tests on the right.
